title: Write Ratios to Describe Relationships
description: Learn to write ratios comparing two quantities

questions.question: A bag has 3 red and 5 blue marbles. What is the ratio of red to blue?
questions.hint: Ratio of A to B is written A:B

questions.question: There are 12 boys and 8 girls in a class. What is the ratio of boys to girls?
questions.hint: Put the first quantity mentioned before the colon

questions.question: A recipe uses 2 cups flour and 1 cup sugar. What is the ratio of flour to sugar?
questions.hint: Write flour amount first, then sugar amount

questions.question: A garden has 15 roses and 10 tulips. What is the ratio of tulips to roses?
questions.hint: Tulips are mentioned first in the question

questions.question: Which ratio represents 4 cats to 7 dogs?
In a parking lot, there are 20 cars and 5 motorcycles. What is the ratio of motorcycles to cars?
A fruit bowl has 6 apples, 4 oranges, and 2 bananas. What is the ratio of apples to oranges?
questions.hint: Only compare apples and oranges, ignore bananas

questions.question: There are 9 fiction books and 3 non-fiction books. What is the ratio of fiction to non-fiction?
A team won 7 games and lost 3 games. What is the ratio of wins to losses?
In a bag of candy, there are 8 red and 12 green candies. What is the ratio of red to total?
A necklace has 5 gold beads for every 2 silver beads. Write this ratio.

title: Simplify Ratios
description: Reduce ratios to their simplest form

questions.question: Simplify the ratio 8:12
questions.hint: Divide both numbers by their GCF (4)

questions.question: Simplify the ratio 15:25
Simplify the ratio 24:36
Simplify the ratio 10:10
questions.hint: When both numbers are equal, the simplest form is 1:1

questions.question: Simplify the ratio 18:24
Simplify the ratio 21:35
Simplify the ratio 40:50
Simplify the ratio 16:20
Simplify the ratio 9:27
Simplify the ratio 14:21
Which ratio is equivalent to 6:9 in simplest form?
Simplify the ratio 30:45

title: Identify Equivalent Ratios
description: Find ratios that represent the same relationship

questions.question: Which ratio is equivalent to 2:3?
Which ratio is equivalent to 5:10?
Which ratio is NOT equivalent to 3:4?
questions.hint: Check if each ratio simplifies to 3:4

questions.question: Find the equivalent ratio: 4:5 = 8:?
Find the equivalent ratio: 6:9 = ?:3
Which pair of ratios are equivalent?
questions.hint: Check which pair has the same simplified form

questions.question: Find the missing value: 3:7 = 9:?
Which ratio is equivalent to 12:16?
Find the missing value: ?:12 = 5:6
Which ratio is equivalent to 7:8?
Find the missing value: 15:20 = 3:?

title: Use Ratio Tables
description: Complete and analyze ratio tables

questions.question: In a ratio table, if 2:5 becomes 4:10, what comes next?
questions.hint: Add 2 to the first value and 5 to the second

questions.question: A table shows cups of flour to eggs: 3:2, 6:4, 9:?
Red paint to blue paint: 1:4, 2:8, 3:?
Miles to hours: 60:1, 120:2, ?:3
Dogs to cats: 5:3, 10:6, 15:?
Pencils to erasers: 4:1, 8:2, 12:?
Apples to oranges: 2:7, 4:14, ?:21
Lemonade concentrate to water: 1:3, 2:6, 4:?
Wins to losses: 7:2, 14:4, 21:?

title: Solve Ratio Word Problems
description: Apply ratios to real-world situations

questions.question: The ratio of cats to dogs at a shelter is 3:5. If there are 15 cats, how many dogs are there?
A recipe uses sugar and flour in a 2:5 ratio. If you use 10 cups of flour, how much sugar?
Boys and girls are in a 4:3 ratio. If there are 28 boys, how many girls?
Red and blue marbles are in a 5:2 ratio. If there are 35 total, how many are red?
A map scale is 1:50. If a road is 3 cm on the map, how long is it in real life?
Orange juice to water is 1:4. To make 15 cups total, how much water?
The ratio of adults to children is 2:7. If there are 63 people total, how many adults?
A trail mix has nuts to raisins in a 3:2 ratio. With 12 cups of nuts, how many cups of raisins?
Pencils and pens are in a 5:3 ratio. If there are 40 pencils, how many pens?
A solution has acid to water in a 1:9 ratio. In 500 mL of solution, how much is acid?
Teachers to students ratio is 1:15. With 8 teachers, how many students?

title: Understand Proportions
description: Learn what proportions are and how to identify them

questions.question: Which shows a proportion?
questions.hint: A proportion means two ratios are equal

questions.question: Is 3/4 = 6/8 a true proportion?
Which pair forms a proportion?
questions.hint: Check if they simplify to the same fraction

questions.question: Is 4/5 = 12/15 a true proportion?
Which does NOT form a proportion with 2/7?
questions.hint: All except one are equivalent to 2/7

questions.question: Is 5/8 = 15/24 a true proportion?
Which statement describes a proportion?
Is 7/9 = 14/18 a true proportion?
Which pair does NOT form a proportion?
Is 6/10 = 9/15 a true proportion?

title: Solve Proportions
description: Find missing values in proportions using cross multiplication

questions.question: Solve: 3/4 = x/12
Solve: 5/8 = 15/x
Solve: x/6 = 10/15
Solve: 7/x = 21/27
Solve: 4/9 = 20/x
Solve: x/5 = 24/30
Solve: 6/11 = x/33
Solve: 8/x = 24/15
Solve: 9/12 = x/16
Solve: x/7 = 18/21

title: Proportion Word Problems
description: Apply proportions to solve real-world problems

questions.question: If 3 apples cost $2, how much do 12 apples cost?
A car travels 150 miles in 3 hours. How far in 5 hours at the same speed?
If 5 workers finish a job in 8 days, how long for 10 workers?
A recipe for 4 serves uses 6 eggs. How many eggs for 10 servings?
On a map, 2 cm = 50 km. How far is 7 cm in real distance?
If 8 pencils cost $6, how many pencils can you buy with $15?
A machine makes 240 parts in 6 hours. How many in 10 hours?
If 12 gallons fill 2/3 of a tank, how many gallons fill the whole tank?
A shadow is 8 feet when a 6-foot person stands. What's the shadow of a 9-foot tree?
If 15 books weigh 24 pounds, how much do 25 books weigh?

title: Understand Rates
description: Learn to identify and write rates

questions.question: What is a rate?
questions.hint: Rates compare quantities with different units

questions.question: Which is a rate?
questions.hint: Rates have different units (dollars and hours)

questions.question: A car travels 240 miles in 4 hours. What is the rate?
If you earn $45 for 5 hours of work, what is your rate of pay?
A printer prints 120 pages in 10 minutes. What is the rate?
Which represents '35 miles per gallon'?
A faucet drips 24 drops in 4 minutes. What is the rate?
You read 150 pages in 3 days. What is your reading rate?
A recipe uses 2 cups sugar for 8 cookies. What is the rate?
Which unit describes a speed rate?

title: Calculate Unit Rates
description: Find rates per one unit

questions.question: Find the unit rate: $24 for 6 items
Find the unit rate: 350 miles in 7 hours
Find the unit rate: 180 words in 3 minutes
Find the unit rate: $13.50 for 3 pounds
Find the unit rate: 45 students in 3 classes
Find the unit rate: 72 heartbeats in 60 seconds
Find the unit rate: $36 for 8 gallons of gas
Find the unit rate: 156 miles on 6 gallons
Find the unit rate: 420 calories in 3 servings
Find the unit rate: $84 for 12 tickets
Find the unit rate: 250 meters in 50 seconds

title: Compare Unit Rates
description: Use unit rates to compare and make decisions

questions.question: Which is the better buy: 3 for $6 or 5 for $9?
Car A: 280 miles on 8 gallons. Car B: 240 miles on 6 gallons. Which is more efficient?
Store X: 12 oz for $4.80. Store Y: 16 oz for $6.08. Which is cheaper per ounce?
Runner A: 2 miles in 16 min. Runner B: 3 miles in 21 min. Who is faster?
questions.hint: A: 16÷2=8 min/mile. B: 21÷3=7 min/mile (lower is faster)

questions.question: Job A: $72 for 8 hours. Job B: $85 for 10 hours. Which pays more per hour?
Pack A: 24 pencils for $6. Pack B: 36 pencils for $8. Which is the better value?
Machine A: 150 items in 5 min. Machine B: 240 items in 8 min. Which is faster?
Plan A: 5 GB for $25. Plan B: 8 GB for $36. Which has better price per GB?
Pool A fills at 120 gallons in 4 min. Pool B at 200 gallons in 8 min. Which fills faster?
Brand X: 18 oz cereal for $5.40. Brand Y: 24 oz for $6.48. Better deal?

title: Rate Word Problems
description: Solve real-world problems using rates

questions.question: A car travels 55 mph. How far does it go in 4 hours?
At $12 per hour, how much do you earn in 7.5 hours?
A faucet leaks 2 gallons per day. How much in 2 weeks?
You type 45 words per minute. How many words in 8 minutes?
Gas costs $4.25 per gallon. How much for 12 gallons?
A plane flies 500 mph. How long to fly 2,000 miles?
You earn $56 in 7 hours. At this rate, how much in 12 hours?
A factory makes 180 widgets per hour. How many in a 9-hour shift?
Water flows at 15 liters per minute. How long to fill a 450-liter tank?
A recipe needs 3 cups flour for 24 cookies. How much flour for 40 cookies?

title: Convert Rates Between Units
description: Change rates from one unit to another

questions.question: Convert 60 miles per hour to miles per minute.
Convert $720 per month to dollars per week (4 weeks/month).
Convert 12 feet per second to feet per minute.
Convert 24 gallons per day to gallons per hour.
Convert 300 words per minute to words per hour.
Convert $15 per hour to dollars per 8-hour day.
Convert 90 km per hour to km per minute.
Convert 365 pages per week to pages per day.
Convert 480 beats per minute to beats per second.
Convert 5 meters per second to meters per minute.

title: Understand Percent
description: Learn what percent means and basic conversions

questions.question: What does 'percent' mean?
What is 50% as a fraction?
What is 25% as a decimal?
What is 0.75 as a percent?
What is 3/4 as a percent?
What is 100% of any number?
What is 0.05 as a percent?
What is 1/5 as a percent?
What is 150% as a decimal?
What is 2/5 as a percent?
What is 0.125 as a percent?

title: Find Percent of a Number
description: Calculate a percentage of a given number

questions.question: What is 10% of 80?
What is 25% of 120?
What is 50% of 64?
What is 20% of 45?
What is 75% of 200?
What is 15% of 60?
What is 5% of 240?
What is 40% of 75?
What is 30% of 150?
What is 12% of 50?
What is 80% of 55?

title: Find the Whole Given a Percent
description: Work backwards from a percent to find the original number

questions.question: 15 is 25% of what number?
24 is 20% of what number?
18 is 50% of what number?
7 is 10% of what number?
45 is 75% of what number?
12 is 30% of what number?
8 is 5% of what number?
35 is 70% of what number?
21 is 15% of what number?
54 is 60% of what number?

title: Find What Percent One Number Is of Another
description: Calculate what percentage one number is of another

questions.question: What percent of 50 is 10?
What percent of 80 is 20?
What percent of 60 is 45?
What percent of 200 is 30?
What percent of 40 is 8?
What percent of 75 is 15?
What percent of 120 is 36?
What percent of 25 is 5?
What percent of 90 is 27?
What percent of 150 is 75?

title: Percent Increase and Decrease
description: Calculate percent change between values

questions.question: A price increased from $40 to $50. What is the percent increase?
A number decreased from 80 to 60. What is the percent decrease?
If a $60 item is marked 20% off, what is the sale price?
A population grew from 200 to 250. What is the percent increase?
A $80 jacket is on sale for 15% off. What is the sale price?
After a 10% increase, a number is 55. What was the original?
A $25 item with 8% tax. What is the total cost?
Stock dropped from $50 to $40. What is the percent decrease?
A worker got a 5% raise on $400/week. What is the new pay?
After a 20% discount, a shirt costs $24. What was the original price?

title: Percent Word Problems
description: Apply percent concepts to real-world situations

questions.question: A test has 40 questions. You got 32 correct. What percent?
A store has 25% off. A $60 item now costs:
Sales tax is 6%. A $50 purchase totals:
A team won 18 of 24 games. What percent did they win?
You save 15% of $200 monthly. How much do you save per year?
A tip of 20% on a $35 meal is:
A car's value dropped 10% from $20,000. New value:
30% of students walk to school. There are 450 students. How many walk?
A recipe calls for 2 cups flour. To make 150%, how many cups?
You scored 45 out of 60. A friend scored 70%. Who did better?

title: Understand Positive and Negative Integers
description: Learn about integers and their positions on a number line

questions.question: Which number is negative?
questions.hint: Negative numbers have a minus sign

questions.question: What is the opposite of 7?
questions.hint: Opposite means same distance from 0 but other side

questions.question: Which is greater: -5 or -2?
questions.hint: -2 is closer to 0, so it's greater

questions.question: What temperature is 5 degrees below zero?
Order from least to greatest: 3, -1, 0, -4
What integer represents 8 floors below ground?
Which is closest to 0: -6, -2, 4, or -9?
What is the absolute value of -12?
questions.hint: Absolute value is distance from 0 (always positive)

questions.question: Which integer is between -5 and -3?
questions.hint: Look for a number greater than -5 but less than -3

questions.question: A diver is at -30 feet. A fish is at -15 feet. Which is deeper?
questions.hint: -30 is more negative, so deeper underwater

title: Add Integers
description: Add positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is 5 + (-3)?
What is -4 + (-6)?
questions.hint: Both negative: add and keep negative sign

questions.question: What is -7 + 10?
What is 8 + (-8)?
questions.hint: A number plus its opposite equals zero

questions.question: What is -12 + 5?
What is -3 + (-9)?
questions.hint: Add the absolute values: 3 + 9 = 12, keep negative

questions.question: What is 15 + (-20)?
What is -6 + 6?
What is -11 + (-4)?
What is 9 + (-14)?
What is -25 + 18?

title: Subtract Integers
description: Subtract positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is 5 - 8?
What is 7 - (-3)?
What is -4 - 6?
What is -9 - (-5)?
What is 0 - 7?
What is 3 - (-9)?
What is -8 - 4?
What is 10 - 15?
What is -6 - (-10)?
What is -20 - 5?

title: Multiply Integers
description: Multiply positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is 4 × (-3)?
What is (-7) × 8?
What is 9 × (-2)?
What is 0 × (-15)?
What is (-3) × 7?
What is 6 × (-6)?
What is (-10) × 4?

title: Divide Integers
description: Divide positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is 24 ÷ (-6)?
What is (-48) ÷ 8?
What is 56 ÷ (-8)?
What is 0 ÷ (-12)?
questions.hint: Zero divided by any non-zero number is zero

questions.question: What is (-81) ÷ 9?
What is 72 ÷ (-9)?
What is (-36) ÷ 4?

title: Integer Word Problems
description: Apply integer operations to real-world contexts

questions.question: The temperature was -8°F and rose 15 degrees. What is it now?
A submarine at -200 feet descends 50 more feet. New depth?
You have $45. You spend $60. What is your balance?
An elevator goes from floor -2 to floor 5. How many floors did it travel?
It was -12°C in the morning. By noon it was 3°C. How much did it change?
A company lost $5000 each month for 4 months. Total loss?
A football team gained 8 yards, then lost 12 yards. Net yardage?
The Dead Sea is 430 meters below sea level. Write as integer.
A stock dropped 3 points each day for 6 days. Total change?
The temperature at 6 AM was -5°C. It dropped 8 more degrees. What is it now?

title: Write Algebraic Expressions
description: Translate words into algebraic expressions

questions.question: Write an expression for 'five more than a number n'
Write an expression for 'twice a number x'
Write an expression for 'a number y divided by 4'
questions.hint: 'Divided by' means the number comes first

questions.question: Write an expression for '7 less than a number m'
questions.hint: 'Less than' means subtract from the number

questions.question: Write an expression for 'the product of 3 and p'
Write an expression for 'half of a number h'
Write an expression for '4 times a number k, plus 3'
Write an expression for 'a number w decreased by 9'
Write an expression for 'the sum of a number z and 12'
Write an expression for 'a number t squared'
questions.hint: 'Squared' means raised to the power of 2

questions.question: Write an expression for '6 subtracted from a number r'
questions.hint: 'Subtracted from' means take away from the number

title: Evaluate Expressions
description: Substitute values and calculate expression values

questions.question: Evaluate 3x + 2 when x = 4
Evaluate 5n - 7 when n = 3
Evaluate 2(y + 4) when y = 5
Evaluate x² + 3 when x = 4
Evaluate 20/a when a = 5
Evaluate 4m - 2m when m = 6
Evaluate 3x + 2y when x = 2 and y = 5
Evaluate (n + 3)² when n = 2
Evaluate 6 + 4k when k = 7
Evaluate 2p² when p = 3
Evaluate 10 - 2x when x = -3

title: Simplify Expressions by Combining Like Terms
description: Combine like terms to simplify algebraic expressions

questions.question: Simplify: 3x + 5x
Simplify: 7y - 2y
Simplify: 4a + 3 + 2a
Simplify: 8m - 3m + 5
Simplify: 2x + 3y + 5x + y
questions.hint: Combine x terms: 2x + 5x = 7x. Combine y terms: 3y + y = 4y

questions.question: Simplify: 6n - n
Simplify: 9 + 4p - 2 + p
questions.hint: Combine p terms: 4p + p = 5p. Combine constants: 9 - 2 = 7

questions.question: Simplify: 10b - 4b + 2b
Simplify: 3x² + 2x²
questions.hint: Like terms have the same variable and exponent

questions.question: Simplify: 7k + 4 - 3k - 1
Simplify: 5w + 2w - 8 + 3

title: Solve One-Step Equations: Addition and Subtraction
description: Solve equations by adding or subtracting

questions.question: Solve: x + 5 = 12
Solve: y - 8 = 15
Solve: n + 14 = 20
Solve: m - 9 = 7
Solve: 25 = a + 11
Solve: p - 6 = -2
Solve: x + 7 = 3
Solve: 18 = k - 5
Solve: w + (-3) = 10
questions.hint: w + (-3) is the same as w - 3 = 10

questions.question: Solve: b - 12 = 0
Solve: 9 + t = 2

title: Solve One-Step Equations: Multiplication and Division
description: Solve equations by multiplying or dividing

questions.question: Solve: 3x = 18
Solve: y/4 = 5
Solve: 7n = 42
Solve: m/6 = 8
Solve: 5a = 45
Solve: p/3 = 12
Solve: -4x = 20
Solve: k/5 = -7
Solve: 8w = 56
Solve: n/9 = 4
Solve: -6b = -48

title: Solve Two-Step Equations
description: Solve equations requiring two operations

questions.question: Solve: 2x + 5 = 13
questions.hint: First subtract 5: 2x = 8. Then divide by 2: x = 4

questions.question: Solve: 3y - 7 = 14
Solve: 4n + 3 = 19
Solve: 5m - 2 = 23
Solve: x/3 + 4 = 9
Solve: 6a - 8 = 28
Solve: 2k + 9 = 3
Solve: p/4 - 3 = 5
Solve: 7w + 6 = 34
Solve: 3b - 10 = -1
Solve: 8 + 2t = 20

title: Write and Solve Equation Word Problems
description: Translate word problems into equations and solve

questions.question: A number plus 8 equals 15. What is the number?
Three times a number is 27. What is the number?
A number divided by 5 is 8. What is the number?
Six less than a number is 10. What is the number?
Twice a number plus 4 equals 18. What is the number?
A book costs $4 more than $12. What is the cost?
Half a number minus 3 is 7. What is the number?
questions.hint: Equation: x/2 - 3 = 7. First: x/2 = 10. Then: x = 20

questions.question: Four times a number, decreased by 5, is 15. What is the number?
The sum of a number and 9 is 24. What is the number?
A number divided by 3, plus 6, equals 10. What is the number?
questions.hint: Equation: x/3 + 6 = 10. First: x/3 = 4. Then: x = 12

title: Understand and Write Inequalities
description: Learn inequality symbols and write inequalities from words

questions.question: What does the symbol < mean?
questions.hint: The symbol points to the smaller value

questions.question: What does the symbol ≥ mean?
questions.hint: The line under means 'or equal to'

questions.question: Write: 'x is greater than 5'
Write: 'y is at most 10'
questions.hint: 'At most' means less than or equal to

questions.question: Write: 'n is at least 7'
questions.hint: 'At least' means greater than or equal to

questions.question: Write: 'a is less than or equal to 12'
questions.hint: Use ≤ for 'less than or equal to'

questions.question: Which is true: 4 < 7 or 4 > 7?
Write: 'Temperature t is below 32°'
Which shows 'b is no more than 15'?
questions.hint: 'No more than' means less than or equal to

questions.question: Is x = 5 a solution to x > 3?
Write: 'Speed s must exceed 60 mph'

title: Solve One-Step Inequalities
description: Solve simple inequalities and graph solutions

questions.question: Solve: x + 3 > 7
Solve: y - 5 ≤ 8
Solve: 2n < 14
Solve: m/3 ≥ 4
Solve: a + 9 ≤ 15
Solve: 5k > 35
Solve: p - 4 > -2
Solve: w/6 < 5
Which value is NOT a solution to x > 5?
questions.hint: x must be greater than 5, not equal to it

questions.question: Solve: b + 7 < 4
Which value IS a solution to n ≤ 8?
questions.hint: n can equal 8 because of the ≤ symbol

title: Inequality Word Problems
description: Write and solve inequalities from real-world situations

questions.question: You need at least $50 for a game. You have $32. How much more do you need?
A bag can hold at most 20 lbs. You have 13 lbs. How much more can you add?
The speed limit is 65 mph. Write an inequality for legal speeds s.
questions.hint: You can drive at or below the limit

questions.question: A ride requires height h > 48 inches. Can someone 48 inches ride?
questions.hint: h must be greater than 48, not equal to it

questions.question: You must be at least 16 to drive. Write the inequality for age a.
questions.hint: 'At least' means greater than or equal to

questions.question: A test needs more than 70 points to pass. What scores pass?
A pool's capacity is no more than 50 people. Write the inequality.
questions.hint: 'No more than' means less than or equal to

questions.question: An elevator holds up to 2000 lbs. 5 people weigh 180 lbs each. How much more weight w is allowed?
A sale item must cost less than $25. Which could be the price?
questions.hint: Price must be less than $25, not equal

questions.question: You have $15 and want to buy notebooks at $3 each. How many n can you buy?

title: Find the Area of Triangles
description: Calculate the area of triangles using base and height

questions.question: Find the area of a triangle with base 8 cm and height 6 cm.
Find the area of a triangle with base 10 in and height 4 in.
A triangle has area 30 m² and base 10 m. What is its height?
Find the area of a triangle with base 12 ft and height 5 ft.
What is the formula for area of a triangle?
questions.hint: Triangle area is half of base times height

questions.question: A triangle has base 7 cm and height 8 cm. Find its area.
Find the area: base = 15 m, height = 4 m
A triangle has area 45 cm² and height 9 cm. Find the base.
Find the area of a triangle with base 20 in and height 7 in.
A triangle and rectangle have the same base and height. How do their areas compare?
Find the area: base = 9 ft, height = 12 ft

title: Find the Area of Parallelograms
description: Calculate the area of parallelograms

questions.question: Find the area of a parallelogram with base 9 cm and height 4 cm.
Find the area: base = 12 in, height = 5 in
A parallelogram has area 48 m² and base 8 m. What is its height?
What is the formula for area of a parallelogram?
questions.hint: Parallelogram area is base times height

questions.question: Find the area: base = 7 ft, height = 9 ft
A parallelogram has area 72 cm² and height 8 cm. Find the base.
Find the area of a parallelogram: base = 15 m, height = 6 m
Why isn't the slant side used to find area of a parallelogram?
options: Height must be perpendicular to base
questions.answer: Height must be perpendicular to base
questions.hint: The height is the perpendicular distance between bases

questions.question: Find the area: base = 11 in, height = 8 in
A parallelogram has base 10 cm and height 10 cm. Is it a square?
questions.hint: A square is a special parallelogram with right angles

questions.question: Find the area: base = 14 ft, height = 3 ft

title: Find the Area of Trapezoids
description: Calculate the area of trapezoids using both bases and height

questions.question: Find the area of a trapezoid with bases 6 cm and 10 cm, height 4 cm.
What is the formula for area of a trapezoid?
questions.hint: Add the two bases, multiply by height, then halve

questions.question: Find the area: bases 8 in and 12 in, height 5 in
A trapezoid has area 45 m², bases 5 m and 10 m. Find the height.
Find the area: bases 4 ft and 8 ft, height 6 ft
Find the area: bases 7 cm and 11 cm, height 8 cm
A trapezoid has equal bases of 9 m each and height 4 m. What shape is it really?
questions.hint: If both bases are equal, it's a parallelogram

questions.question: Find the area: bases 5 in and 15 in, height 4 in
A trapezoid has area 56 cm², height 7 cm, and one base is 6 cm. Find the other base.
Find the area: bases 9 m and 15 m, height 10 m

title: Find Area of Composite Figures
description: Break down complex shapes and find total area

questions.question: An L-shaped figure is made of two rectangles: 4×6 and 3×5. Find total area.
A rectangle 10×8 has a 2×3 rectangle cut out. Find remaining area.
To find area of a complex shape, what should you do?
questions.hint: Decompose, then add or subtract areas

questions.question: A shape is a square (5×5) with a triangle (base 5, height 3) on top. Total area?
A 12×10 rectangle has a triangle (base 6, height 4) cut out. Remaining area?
Two squares, 4×4 and 6×6, are joined. Total area?
A rectangle is 8×6. A 2×2 square is inside it. Area outside the square?
A parallelogram (base 10, height 6) with a triangle (base 4, height 3) removed. Area?
A T-shape: top is 8×2, stem is 2×6. Total area?
A rectangle 9×7 minus a rectangle 3×4. Remaining area?

title: Find Surface Area of Rectangular Prisms
description: Calculate the total surface area of boxes and prisms

questions.question: Find the surface area of a box: length 4, width 3, height 2
What is the formula for surface area of a rectangular prism?
questions.hint: There are 3 pairs of rectangular faces

questions.question: Find SA: length 5 cm, width 5 cm, height 5 cm (cube)
Find SA: l = 6 in, w = 4 in, h = 3 in
A cube has surface area 96 cm². What is the side length?
Find SA: l = 10 m, w = 2 m, h = 3 m
How many faces does a rectangular prism have?
questions.hint: Top, bottom, front, back, left, right

questions.question: Find SA: l = 8 ft, w = 6 ft, h = 2 ft
A gift box is 12×8×4 inches. How much wrapping paper is needed?
Find SA: l = 7 cm, w = 4 cm, h = 5 cm

title: Find Volume of Rectangular Prisms
description: Calculate volume using length, width, and height

questions.question: Find the volume: length 5, width 4, height 3
What is the formula for volume of a rectangular prism?
Find volume of a cube with side 4 cm
Find V: l = 8 in, w = 5 in, h = 2 in
A box holds 120 cm³. If l = 6 and w = 4, what is h?
Find V: l = 10 m, w = 3 m, h = 4 m
What unit is used for volume?
Find V: l = 9 ft, w = 6 ft, h = 2 ft
A fish tank is 24×12×18 inches. What is its volume?
Find V: l = 7 cm, w = 7 cm, h = 3 cm
A cube has volume 27 m³. What is its side length?

title: Find Volume of Triangular Prisms
description: Calculate volume using base area times height

questions.question: A triangular prism has base 6 cm, height of triangle 4 cm, and length 10 cm. Find volume.
What is the formula for volume of a triangular prism?
questions.hint: Find triangle area first, then multiply by length

questions.question: Triangle base 8 in, triangle height 3 in, prism length 5 in. Volume?
A tent is triangular: base 4 m, height 3 m, length 6 m. Volume inside?
Triangle base 10 ft, triangle height 6 ft, length 8 ft. Volume?
A prism has triangular base area 15 cm² and length 7 cm. Volume?
Triangle base 12 m, triangle height 5 m, length 4 m. Volume?
A triangular prism has volume 90 cm³. Triangle area is 15 cm². Find length.
Triangle base 5 in, triangle height 4 in, length 9 in. Volume?
Which has greater volume: rectangular prism 4×3×5 or triangular prism (base 6, height 4, length 5)?

title: Volume Word Problems
description: Apply volume concepts to real-world situations

questions.question: A fish tank is 30 cm long, 20 cm wide, and 25 cm tall. How many cubic cm of water can it hold?
A box holds 240 cubic inches. If it's 8 in long and 6 in wide, how tall is it?
A swimming pool is 25 m × 10 m × 2 m. Volume in cubic meters?
A moving box is 2 ft × 2 ft × 3 ft. How many fit in a truck space 12 ft × 8 ft × 6 ft?
A juice box is 6 cm × 4 cm × 10 cm. How many mL does it hold? (1 cm³ = 1 mL)
A cube has volume 8 cubic feet. What is its side length?
A sandbox is 6 ft × 5 ft × 1 ft. Sand costs $2 per cubic foot. Total cost?
A shipping container is 40 ft × 8 ft × 9 ft. Volume?
A pool fills at 50 gallons per minute. If volume is 15,000 gallons, how long to fill?
Two boxes: A is 3×4×5, B is 2×6×5. Which holds more?

title: Find the Mean (Average)
description: Calculate the arithmetic mean of a data set

questions.question: Find the mean: 4, 8, 6, 10, 12
Find the mean: 15, 20, 25, 30, 35
Test scores: 85, 90, 78, 92, 80. What is the mean?
What is another word for mean?
questions.hint: Mean and average are the same thing

questions.question: Find the mean: 3, 7, 5, 9, 6
Find the mean: 100, 200, 300
The mean of 4 numbers is 10. What is their sum?
Find the mean: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12
Heights (in inches): 58, 62, 60, 64, 56. Mean height?
The mean of 5 numbers is 12. If 4 numbers sum to 45, what is the 5th?
questions.hint: Total sum must be 60. Fifth number: 60 - 45 = 15

title: Find the Median
description: Identify the middle value in an ordered data set

questions.question: Find the median: 3, 7, 9, 12, 15
questions.hint: Middle value of ordered list is 9

questions.question: Find the median: 8, 3, 5, 1, 9
Find the median: 12, 18, 14, 20, 16, 22
What is the median?
Find the median: 45, 32, 67, 54, 28
Find the median: 2, 4, 6, 8
Test scores: 72, 85, 90, 78, 88. Median?
Data: 5, 5, 5, 5, 5. What is the median?
questions.hint: All values are the same, so median is 5

questions.question: Ages: 25, 30, 35, 40. Median age?

title: Find the Mode
description: Identify the most frequently occurring value

questions.question: Find the mode: 2, 4, 4, 6, 8
Find the mode: 5, 7, 7, 7, 9, 9
questions.hint: 7 appears 3 times, more than any other

questions.question: What is the mode?
Find the mode: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50
questions.hint: All values appear once - no mode

questions.question: Find the mode: 3, 3, 5, 5, 7
Shoe sizes: 8, 9, 8, 10, 8, 9, 11. Mode?
Find the mode: 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3
Colors chosen: red, blue, red, green, red, blue. Mode?
Grades: A, B, B, C, B, A, C. Mode?
Can a data set have more than one mode?
questions.hint: Data can be bimodal or multimodal

title: Find the Range
description: Calculate the spread of data using range

questions.question: Find the range: 5, 12, 8, 3, 15
What is range?
questions.hint: Range measures the spread of data

questions.question: Find the range: 20, 35, 28, 42, 31
Temperatures: 68°F, 72°F, 65°F, 75°F, 70°F. Range?
Find the range: 100, 100, 100, 100
Find the range: -5, 3, -2, 8, 0
Test scores: 78, 92, 85, 88, 95. Range?
A large range indicates what about data?

title: Compare Mean, Median, and Mode
description: Choose the best measure of center for different situations

questions.question: Data: 2, 3, 3, 4, 100. Which measure is most affected by the outlier?
questions.hint: The mean includes the extreme value 100 in its calculation

questions.question: For data: 5, 5, 6, 7, 8, which is true?
Which measure is best for shoe sizes sold at a store?
questions.hint: Most popular size (most sold) is most useful

questions.question: Data: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. Mean and median are:
House prices: $100K, $120K, $130K, $140K, $900K. Best measure of typical price?
questions.hint: Median isn't affected by the extreme $900K

questions.question: For data: 7, 7, 7, 8, 8, find mean, median, mode.
questions.hint: Mean: 37÷5=7.4. Median: middle value=7. Mode: 7 (appears 3 times)

questions.question: Which measure can have more than one value?
Salaries: $30K, $35K, $40K, $45K, $200K. Which is misleading?
questions.hint: Mean = $70K, but most earn far less

questions.question: Data: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. The mean is 3. If we add 10 to each value, new mean is:
questions.hint: Adding same number to all values shifts mean by that amount

questions.question: When would you use range instead of mean?
options: To show how spread out data is
questions.answer: To show how spread out data is

title: Interpret Data from Graphs
description: Read and analyze bar graphs, line graphs, and histograms

questions.question: A bar graph shows: Mon=5, Tue=8, Wed=6, Thu=9, Fri=7. What is the total?
In the same data, which day had the most?
A histogram shows ages: 0-10: 5, 11-20: 12, 21-30: 8. How many total people?
What type of graph is best for showing change over time?
questions.hint: Line graphs show trends over time

questions.question: A circle graph shows: A=25%, B=35%, C=?. What percent is C?
Sales data: Q1=$200, Q2=$250, Q3=$225, Q4=$325. Mean quarterly sales?
A line graph goes up from left to right. This shows:
Survey of 60 students: 20 chose pizza, 15 chose tacos. How many chose 'other'?
A histogram has no gaps between bars. Why?
Temperatures for a week: 72, 75, 68, 80, 76, 74, 71. Range?

title: Create and Interpret Dot Plots
description: Analyze data displayed in dot plots

questions.question: A dot plot shows: 5(●●), 6(●●●), 7(●●●●), 8(●). What is the mode?
Using the same dot plot, how many total data points?
Using the same dot plot, what is the range?
What does each dot represent in a dot plot?
questions.hint: Each dot = one piece of data

questions.question: Dot plot: 10(●●●), 11(●●), 12(●●●●●), 13(●). Median?
questions.hint: 11 data points. Middle values are 11 and 12. Wait, let me recount: 3+2+5+1=11 points. 6th value = 12

questions.question: A dot plot has a gap between 4 and 7. What does this mean?
questions.hint: Gaps show missing values in data

questions.question: Which shows individual data values best?
questions.hint: Dot plots show each individual data point

questions.question: Dot plot: 2(●●), 3(●●●), 4(●●●●), 5(●). What is the sum?
A cluster in a dot plot means:
